title: Teemo Hat!
body:
My friend sent the best Christmas gift for our new baby! I just had to share it :)

http://i.imgur.com/TMK9T7H.jpg

replies.body: D'awwww!
Hey Katey, what's a content QA analyst?

> [{quoted}](name=The AFK Farmer,realm=NA,application-id=2XjzURgc,discussion-id=Q1V384u8,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2015-01-07T23:32:02.584+0000)
>
> Hey Katey, what's a content QA analyst?

It varies by team, but basically we help advise in the development process, make sure things not only function properly, but also make sure they look nice. We also creep the boards and grab feedback about new content.
She makes sure that content is "D'awwww!" worthy obviously!

> [{quoted}](name=Arliden,realm=NA,application-id=2XjzURgc,discussion-id=Q1V384u8,comment-id=0001,timestamp=2015-01-07T23:33:29.294+0000)
>
> She makes sure that content is "D'awwww!" worthy obviously!

Yes, this. This needs to be in my job description.

This hat was a labor of love! It was a fun project, but I'm not planning on offering any for sale. However, I'm happy to share how I made it.

The hat itself is a pre-made fleece baby hat with ears. I found it on Amazon. (Search for 'green baby hat' and it should be one of the first results. It's by Zutano.) Then I went to the craft store and bought some felt (red and light blue), some black elastic and teal yarn. I cut two sets of rectangles for the goggles and rounded the corners off, then stitched them together. I cut slits on the sides to thread the elastic through, then stitched the goggles to the hat. I secured the elastic in the front, sides and back, which was really the trickiest part because I didn't want it to be too tight or too loose. Finally, I looked up how to make a tassel online and made one out of yarn, then stitched it onto the top. 

Anyway, here are a couple of pictures of the project sans baby. I only took one while it was in-progress, sorry!

http://i.imgur.com/pF8AcGR.jpg

http://i.imgur.com/YsPfJMm.jpg

> [{quoted}](name=Cainadai,realm=NA,application-id=2XjzURgc,discussion-id=Q1V384u8,comment-id=0009,timestamp=2015-01-08T04:02:00.915+0000)

>

Then I went to the craft store and bought some felt (red and light blue), some black elastic and teal yarn. I cut two sets of rectangles for the goggles and rounded the corners off, then stitched them together. I cut slits on the sides to thread the elastic through, then stitched the goggles to the hat. I secured the elastic in the front, sides and back, which was really the trickiest part because I didn't want it to be too tight or too loose. Finally, I looked up how to make a tassel online and made one out of yarn, then stitched it onto the top. 
> 
> Anyway, here are a couple of pictures of the project sans baby. I only took one while it was in-progress, sorry!
> 
> http://i.imgur.com/pF8AcGR.jpg
> 
> http://i.imgur.com/YsPfJMm.jpg

How creative of you! Thanks for taking the time to post on the forums about it. I am sure that a lot of people are dying to try something like this out. Also, now I am wondering about which other champions we could take a few fashion pointers from. The hair on Diana's Lunar Goddess has me jealous, tbh. Watch out for my tutorial, guys! Now, I just have to spend ten years growing it out to her length...
Don't set him down for too long, his passive might kick in.

so your friend is a satanist?

Is dressing your child in satan-like garb a form of worship? i dont get it
In reality his friend just sacrifised this baby to Satan.

Beware what he drops!  

And yes, D'awwww worthy by far!
If he picks up a straw im taking smite.
Adorable, Just adorable.
That's adorable
